coc.data.package 0.4.1
  • Reference

Match tracts to CoCs

Source: R/coc_county_tract_crosswalk.R
map_tracts_to_cocs.Rd

Calls functions that calculate the center points for tracts in CoCs, match them to the CoC the center point lies within, recombine the tracts in and not in CoCs, and does some light cleaning.

match_tract_to_coc(tract_points, coc_boundaries)

recombine_tracts(tracts_in_cocs, tracts_not_in_cocs)

map_tracts_to_cocs(clipped_tracts, coc_boundaries)

Arguments

tract_points

sf object with the center points of the Census Tracts
coc_boundaries

An sf object with CoC boundaries
tracts_in_cocs

A data frame with tracts matched to CoCs
tracts_not_in_cocs

A data frame with tracts not in CoCs
clipped_tracts

A list with two elements: tracts_in_cocs & tracts_not_in_cocs

Value

A clean data frame of all tracts, their tract population data, and the corresponding CoC if there is one.

Functions

  • match_tract_to_coc: Match Census Tracts to CoCs

    Matches Census Tracts to CoCs based on the CoC the center of the Census Tract lies within.

  • recombine_tracts: Combine tables of tracts in and not in CoCs

    Takes the matched table of tracts in CoCs, joins it with the table of tracts not in CoCs and cleans up the variables.

Contents
